trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the recipient of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader"></xref> is the XML Web service, the XML Web service client, or both.
A <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderAttribute> can be applied to either an XML Web service method or a method of a proxy class to an XML Web service.
In either case, the recipient(s) are specified by the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderAttribute.Direction%2A> property of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderAttribute>.

To specify that an XML Web service method returns a SOAP header when an exception is thrown during its execution, apply an <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderAttribute> to the method and set the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderAttribute.Direction%2A> property to Fault.
Version 1.0 of the .NET Framework does not support the Fault value.
Specifies the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader"></xref> is sent to the XML Web service client when an exception is thrown by the XML Web service method.
Specifies the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader"></xref> is sent to the XML Web service.
Specifies the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader"></xref> is sent to both the XML Web service and the XML Web service client.
Specifies the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader"></xref> is sent to the XML Web service client.
